website_summaries.verdict: The metallic zip-in liner might be a bit much for some, but it keeps you very warm in this classic ski jacket.
pros: Shell is made of a nylon weave,  zip-in liner is 100% polyester fleece
Adjustable hood (also detachable), hem, and cuffs
Uses thermal reflective technology for warmth
Comes in a variety of colors
cons: Shiny liner may not appeal to everyone's taste

customer_reviews.title: ... received this item today but overall build quality looks good. Also I saw people mention the 'shiny' disco ...
customer_reviews.text: I just received this item today but overall build quality looks good. Also I saw people mention the 'shiny' disco ball inside, however I never saw a picture of it. Just to be clear I am attaching a picture of what the inside of the fleece type shell looks like. I got the Slate Grey one so it might not be the same on all of them.
customer_reviews.author: mattATX

customer_reviews.title: Overall this is a great jacket and I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Pros: water resistant, wind resistant, removable fleece liner, breathable and warm at the same time, removable hood, plenty of pocket space, Velcro so you can be lazy and not zip up the jacket Cons: fleece liner is standard grey on all jackets regardless of color. Overall this is a great jacket and I would buy it again. It's everything I was looking for. Buy on amazon and save some cash, this sells for $175 on the Columbia site..i paid right at $100 and it still came with the $175 tag on it.
customer_reviews.author: nickb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for very cold weather
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for very cold weather. 1st day I used it I had to shed the liner as it was way to hot for skiing-this however is not an issue for me as I like skiing in shells. I look forward to the liner and shell come summer-fall camping when I expect I will be get the surprise camping weather of snow-sleet and sunshine all in a few hours. Columbia has always seemed to make great products so if you like Columbia this should not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: Got this jacket mostly for snowboarding but ended up wearing it all winter long. I usually snowboard in -10c to -20c with lots and lots of snow, usually a blizzard, and this jacket kept me warm even with just a small long sleeve underneath. I've been able to go with just a t-shirt underneath and never got cold. The jacket is somewhat on the larger side, but it's a winter coat so I'd expect it to be. Haven't used the jacket without the fleece yet, but plan to in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not for serious cold
customer_reviews.text: Worn in a couple harsh Minnesota winters and I’m really disappointed. If it’s anything below freezing you will feel the chill. It will keep you from being too cold but it’s by no means a warm cozy jacket. The outer shell does little to protect from the cold and the fleece only does about as well as any other fleece. I have to wear at least one more sweater or fleece underneath to feel any kind of warmth in subzero temperatures. My wife has the kind with a puffy jacket underneath and that jacket is much warmer. I’d suggest that jacket over this any day.
customer_reviews.author: Dthiessen

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great coat - unexpected plus!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to update an older Columbia interchangeable jacket I had. I wanted the breast pockets that this model offered and am happy with that. I wish the hood could be rolled under the collar rather than fully detached (I always lose them eventually) but that's a small thing. What I REALLY love and hadn't expected is how thin and light they've made the fleece jacket that zips into this! Consistently I have left the fleeces out of my interchangeable coats because they are so bulky and just uncomfortable. I use them alone and the shell alone. THIS jacket is perfect all put together! Light, not bulky, warm and dry!
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. M.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, warm, & rainproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas. He has enjoyed it so far. I like how versatile it is. The liner zips our to make a warm, stylish jacket. The shell is also wearable on its own, as a light weight, waterproof rain coat. This is truly an all season jacket, which is exactly what I was looking for in a gift. I did knock off 1 star, because the stitching holding the Velcro on the front pocket started unraveling within the first few wears. This is a fixable issue, but still should not have happened so quickly. Still, I would recommend purchasing, it is a very nice system jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Arellanes Ventura

customer_reviews.title: which was no problem at all as Amazon Prime is awesome! Shipped a new large out before I even ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought an X-Large because I read reviews that the product fit somewhat small. I wear an x-large shirt and hoodie so I expected an x-large to fit right. It was far too big. Had to return, which was no problem at all as Amazon Prime is awesome! Shipped a new large out before I even got a chance to put it in the mail. Product was exactly as expected. Very warm, good quality material and good assembly. The hood could be a little bit thicker as it is just a flap of nylon but it works perfectly and covers the head well. Works well with a hat.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice versatile jacket ....only Not waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this jacket a lot in the snow. Now that it's raining I notice that it's not entirely waterproof. Water seeps through the seams at the elbows. Really disappointing since I got rid of all my other jackets thinking this is the one system I need throughout the year. It's also embarrassing and uncomfortable to show up to meetings with wet sleeves. I thought the Gore-Tex and Columbia "Omni-Tech" name stood for something. I am trying the warranty route now that summer is coming and I might be able to go without a jacket for a few weeks, I'll write again if my issue is resolved..
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav Rohatgi

customer_reviews.title: I really like my jacket
customer_reviews.text: I have used my jacket in South America on a 5-week trip and I loved it. I like the feel of the material, and it looks and feels well made. It kept out the rain and cold. I used it without the zip in liner. I think the liner would be great in very cold conditions but I didn't encounter such weather on my trip. The removable hood is nice. The jacket fit me very well. I wish it had zipping capabilities to unzip downward from the neck and upward from the waist when it's completely zipped up, but that's a small complaint and doesn't diminish the overall quality and usefulness of this jacket.
customer_reviews.author: David R Duncan

customer_reviews.title: This is a good jacket!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this jacket. He had a Columbia Sportswear he wore (actually he still wears it for yard work) the crap out of. Its got holes, stains and missing parts but still functioned great. It looked bad though and we got a bonus so we bought him this jacket. Its beautiful to start with (or handsome whatever). The color is nice but still masculine, it has lots of pockets for him to carry all his things, it kept him warm in our ice storm a week ago and its comfy. He says its a little small but not uncomfortably but his old jacket was so big on him I think it was just the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Krislyn

customer_reviews.title: Form a bit over function.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice looking jacket but the seams aren't sealed so don't expect the shell to take a rain beating of any duration. Liner is quite thin, and is grey in color on the black model; doesn't look great to me. Hood is thin, with not the slightest lining. Gerry Crusader is a much better looking and better functioning jacket (hood is not a great fit though). Has a poly fill liner. A better jacket, more features, slightly small fit so be aware of that.
customer_reviews.author: mba

customer_reviews.title: Good length for 5'7", very warm, hood could be better
customer_reviews.text: I bought a mens coat because the sleeves on women's coats tend to be too short for me. I'm 5'7" and this was the perfect length for me. Someone taller might find the torso length is too short. The sleeves are slightly too long, which I like. The coat is very warm. It's been about 20°F here and I've just worn the fleece part. To walk about half a block. I do wish the hood were more thermal though. Overall I'm quite satisfied with this.
customer_reviews.author: Liliana

customer_reviews.title: The inner layer is better left zipped to the main piece
customer_reviews.text: The outer layer is comfortable and appears to be durable, but the inner layer is ugly and has a reflective thermo inner layer that is supposed to mimic an emergency blanket or something. Anyway, it doesn't do that great of a job unless it's paired with the outer layer. I wanted to get the set so I could use them separately. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: James Sigman

customer_reviews.title: Not my perfect winter parka
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 2 stars because it seems like it will keep you warm and made well. But (1) it's very heavy, (2) the collar is very stiff and cuts into your chin and jaw even if you don't zip it all the way to the top, (3) the front zip is not 2-way so you can't adjust when you sit down, (4) there's Velcro everywhere -- along the front flap and in the cuffs -- and Velcro destroys everything it touches.
customer_reviews.author: RunSwimEat

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: My old Eddie Bauer jacket finally ran out of steam and I needed a replacement. The new Eddie Bauer models didn't seem right, so I took a shot with this one from Columbia. It's perfect for me. I bought a XX-Large Tall and it fits me perfectly (6'6", 270 lbs) It has all the features I need: shell can be worn independently, insert can be worn independently, and the hood is detachable. The "shiny disco" design of the insert vest is certainly different, but I like it. This combo covers me in all weather conditions.
customer_reviews.author: JMG

customer_reviews.title: Great Light-weight 3-In-1 Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the warmth per weight, the pockets, the breathability, the color, the zippers, the adjustable cuffs. In North Texas, will wear the outer jacket without the fleece liner most of the time... like that it's rain-proof and has a removable hood. Will use liner during the few cold snaps, and when outdoors for period of time. Have worn liner alone... stayed nice and toasty.
customer_reviews.author: SC Jones

customer_reviews.title: Much larger than expected
customer_reviews.text: I love the jacket, it's just a lot bigger than I expected. I had a Large Columbia fleece jacket already, so I assumed that this one would fit the same. I ordered a Large but really wish that I had ordered a Medium.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Sears

customer_reviews.title: Great, versatile jacket.
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket. Living in an area that gets an average of 10 ft of snow every year, I needed something to keep me warm while out shoveling the driveway, and this jacket has been perfect. It is not too heavy, yet still very warm. Plus, just take out the liner and it makes a nice rain jacket while the inner fleece is perfect by itself for fall/spring.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend ordering a size down
customer_reviews.text: The jacket is very well made and functional. I thought the fabric would be softer but it is kind of stiff, rain coat material. Ordered a 2X regular for my man who goes between a 1X - 2X. The sleeves were too long and overall, it seemed rather big and bulky, even through the torso. I would definitely recommend ordering a size down, especially if you want a more tailored look. We returned it because the metallic silver lining is visible when the coat is slightly unzipped and he didn't like that. He also thought there was too much "stuff" going on around the neck of the coat.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley B.

customer_reviews.title: Multifunctional jacket that works year round.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for my trip to South Korea. The multifunctional ability allowed me to protect in layers, stay warm, and adapt to weather changes. I have used it with and without the hood, w/ and w/o the fleece, as a windbreaker, and in Florida as a rain jacket.
customer_reviews.author: MoJo

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Jacket, especially on the inside.
customer_reviews.text: This Jacket is awesome, at a recent snowy/windy football game, i was fronzen everywhere this jacket didn't touch. I wasn't sweaty, just warm. This Omni Tech disco lining works very well. fits extremely well, just don't like that the sleeves pull out when i put the jacket on, wish they had a way to keep them in place.
customer_reviews.author: mancira

customer_reviews.title: good materials. -fit as expected and large enough to ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros- -Waterproof, warm well made. good materials. -fit as expected and large enough to wear many under layers. I buy alot of columbia clothes and have come to expect alot from them. this did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Westwood

customer_reviews.title: Pockets not convenient to use.
customer_reviews.text: Kept me warm in some semi-cold weather in Vienna. Pockets not as convenient as my older Columbia Jacket. Arrived with a cut in the outer shell which I didn't see until in Vienna. Will have to repair.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Harper

customer_reviews.title: All the other good brands over his hands
customer_reviews.text: My son wears a man's small. Columbia is the only jacket that the arm length is right. All the other good brands over his hands. He usually wears it without the fleece liner, when he is driving to school and on campus. He wears the fleece liner a lot on it's own also. He only puts it together when he is going to stay outside for a longer time.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Versatile raincoat that will keep you warm
customer_reviews.text: One thing I really like is how the bottom of the coat is long enough to ride mid hip. The Onmi-Heat liner traps a plenty of body heat while still being able to breath
customer_reviews.author: piecebypiece

customer_reviews.title: I got this jacket after I ordered the Alpine jacket ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this jacket after I ordered the Alpine jacket in a large, which was too big, but Amazon did not have any smaller sizes in stock. The Bugaboo was warm in ~20 degree skiing weather. Having the separate liner has also been helpful this winter to layer under other coats.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Besos

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Coat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He is 6'2 and about 200 pounds with a long torso and broad shoulders. This fit him so well and he loves it. He does get a lot of comments on the silver sparkly liner that's inside the coat. Other than that, it's probably one of the best coats he's ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Scissor Genie

customer_reviews.title: Always good quality with Columbia!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for our ski trip. It fits great, even over multiple layers. Great quality and very warm. Surprisingly light weight for a winter/ski jacket. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: sunshine_75

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket - waterproof level: n00b skier
customer_reviews.text: Nice color, close to the one on photo. I'm 6' slim with long arms and this fits great. Enough space for a sweater inside for extra cold weather. Hoodie is a little small so it can't fit over a ski helmet very well but that's a minor caveat. Very much waterproof. I feel in the snow constantly and it didn't permeate. Inside lining is a very awesome looking reflective metallic.
customer_reviews.author: edu723

customer_reviews.title: Nice Coat!
customer_reviews.text: I got the 2XL Tall, and boy is it tall! I am 6'4" 280 LBS where a regular length is right at waist level, this one is at least 6" past my waist. But I love this coat, very light weight, and for a typical Michigan winter this will work just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Columbia never disappoints
customer_reviews.text: I had been eyeballing this coat for over a year. I finally broke down and bough it. It is light, not bulky, but is quite warm. It can handle a cold brisk windy day with ease. I would love to try it out on the slopes one of these days!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan J. Chitwood

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome jacket! Its light weight, warm, and water proof. The only draw back is if you don't have a lot of all natural, built in insulation, its not something you're going to want to sit, and not move for awhile, in the Alaskan woods with. But, I do I highly reccomend it highly if you're up and moving.
customer_reviews.author: T. Porter

customer_reviews.title: not warm, sleeves are a nightmare to get into.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Bugaboo jacket from 2004. I wore it skiing in Montana in -40 degree weather no problem. Sleeves slid right on over long sleeves. This one isn't warm at 32 degrees F, and the sleeves catch on bare arms, almost unwearable. Completely useless with thin fleece and that omni heat. Bring back the old design or this is the last columbia jacket that I ever buy. Omni heat only works on ski pants and shirts next to the skin!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Love this jacket
customer_reviews.text: Love this jacket, we have had a mild winter for Idaho but I have worn this coat since early fall and now we are starting into spring. With the removable liner and waterproof shell, this is turning out to be my go-to jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan D

customer_reviews.title: really love the jacket
customer_reviews.text: Has room for undergarments/clothes underneath for winter. Very lightweight, really love the jacket, but have to agree with others that that NASA silver lining inside is a little weird at times, but otherwise a very good jacket. Keeps me pretty warm most of the time, can only really feel it when maybe below 20 degrees, but without being bulky this thing performs incredibly.

customer_reviews.title: I am 6'4" and about 210 lbs with monkey arms ...
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'4" and about 210 lbs with monkey arms. I found this jacket baggy and even the arms were about an inch too long and I wear a 37" sleeve on dress shirts. I ended up getting a Large Tall in the Lhotse which fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: SJHANKS

customer_reviews.title: Best jacket for the price
customer_reviews.text: Best jacket for the price. I used it for skiing and kept me warm in below freezing temps. Probably not the warmest jacket by Columbia. The one thing that bothered my is that the texture of the inner lining is not smooth, so it tends to sticks on your sweeter or whatever you are using under the jacket. Not a terrible thing but annoying after a while.
customer_reviews.author: NE Shopper

customer_reviews.title: One more strap or velcro would have been good to keep them in place
customer_reviews.text: Definitely keeps you warm (with layers) down to single digits. Sheds water well. Only annoyance - the fleece liner's sleeves ride down and out of the jacket when putting it on. One more strap or velcro would have been good to keep them in place.
customer_reviews.author: El Stevo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent jackets. I bought them For my sons for ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent jackets. I bought them For my sons for a ski trip. They stated that they stayed quite warm on the slopes. These jackets are somehow very lightweight, not very bulky but keep you very warm.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fyler

customer_reviews.title: Very light, very warm
customer_reviews.text: Very light, very warm... maybe too warm - serious waterproof wear for COLD weather. Velcro, snaps, and cords in all the right places. Could benefit from more inside pockets. Inner jacket sleeves like to protrude from the outer jacket's cuffs (easily stuffed back into place.) Hood is not lined, so wear a cap under it for warmth. Has undocumented ski-pass clip in the right pocket and another on the lower edge of the outer jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Aardvark

customer_reviews.title: This jacket was perfect. It was a little large
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jacket for a trip to Ireland. My friend who lives there told me to bring a waterproof jacket. This jacket was perfect. It was a little large, but that is good because it allowed me to wear a sweater under it. The sleeves were a little too long, but they cinch up nicely at the wrists with the velcro tabs. This jacket kept me warm and dry the entire time.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lichlyter

customer_reviews.title: Fits more like a bag than a jacket
customer_reviews.text: Seems built for stockier people. Fits more like a bag than a jacket. The inner coat is the right size, but the outer shell is large in the middle. Not nearly as trim fitting as the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan J. Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Warm, looks awesome, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing this coat for over a month now and I can’t get enough of it. Keeps me super warm when it’s down to 10 degrees here. I haven’t tested it out in colder temperatures yet, but something tells me it’ll still do its job.
customer_reviews.author: JamoFromID

customer_reviews.title: Its a good jacket but runs a bit large
customer_reviews.text: Its a good jacket but runs a bit large, which is problematic when snowboarding as extra space gets snow. Excellent material and construction though and once you generate body heat its warm.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Z. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket! great price. Really a great value for money. I bought a large it fits well usually jackets fit me tight around the chest this one fits perfect not tight not loose either. It's is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Balderdash72

customer_reviews.title: Sleeves feel a little tight considering the size I ordered ...
customer_reviews.text: Sleeves feel a little tight considering the size I ordered and the inner liner slides around a lot instead of conforming to the shape of the outer shell
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Trout

customer_reviews.title: great jacket!
customer_reviews.text: Went to jackson hole for a week and wore this jacket 90% of the time. Did great in the rain and snow. Stayed warm and dry. Im 5'11 170lbs and went with a size M. Fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our Alaskan cruise
customer_reviews.text: We bought this jacket for my husband for an Alaskan cruise coming up. It was a perfect fit, arrived on time and is excellent quality as represented in the ad. It is easy to unzip the liner and then zip it back in. I would recommend this jacket for colder weather.
customer_reviews.author: patchwork 55

customer_reviews.title: Love the jacket
customer_reviews.text: Love the jacket. Gives ample protection against the cold, I've tested it up to -20 degrees Celsius over a warm shirt. My only complain is that the outer jacket is a bit on the loose side fitting wise. I ordered a medium and I am a medium from their size chart but this jacket could fit someone 1.5x my size and I'm not lean at all.
customer_reviews.author: Hamza Mustafa

customer_reviews.title: Very nice coat
customer_reviews.text: Coat fits well, blocks wind and rain and very warm without being heavy.
customer_reviews.author: carl eagan

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly Size 3XL
customer_reviews.text: Recently I purchased a winter jacket from their competitor, I had to return it because even though it was the size I wear, it was smaller. When I purchase this jacket I found it to be very comfortable and fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: White Tail Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket. Works well as a lightweight and heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket. Works well as a lightweight and heavy jacket with the removable inner jacket. Over the past few months I have been able to wear the jacket in cold and/or rainy conditions and it kept me warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket.  Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great well made jacket at a great price. It was a little expensive, but worth it. The jacket was exactly as advertised. Sizing was right on. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Castle12

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and not bulky at all
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is very warm and not overly bulky. It fits great over a heavy sweatshirt, though I have not needed to wear as many layers lately since the jacket is quite warm and the temperatures haven't dropped all that low yet this year. Plus I just love the color, no more drab dark winter clothes, the bright colors are nice to see!
customer_reviews.author: BigMikeSndTech

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price and quality but like all "breathable" jackets if ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price and quality but like all "breathable" jackets if you are exercising hard you get wet from sweat. I've never had a jacket that solves that problem, and that includes goretex, helly Hansen, etc. That being said, this one works as well as any of them at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: John A Tyburski

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket, true to size...
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket. Bought this for my husband and the fit was as expected. He's about 6'1, 185lbs and the size Large was a good fit. Got the orange so it could double as a ski jacket and a hunting jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Columbia is not making them like they used to
customer_reviews.text: Not crazy about this jacket. I love my old Columbia (got it about 1999) - this one I’ll tolerate. The flimsy inner jacket always catches on the many, many Velcro strips. Hard to quickly put on, jacket does not glide over clothing. Really wish I bought something else
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: you will be glad you did
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this jacket quite often this winter because of all the rain we've had and I can say it is very water proof. Get one, you will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket for your all your outerwear needs
customer_reviews.text: Great quality from the Columbia brand as you'd expect. The lining zips out to use as a light weight jacket and can use the shell as a raincoat as needed--makes this jacket useful for the fall and spring as well. Price on amazon was nice as well, I look forward to using this jacket for many northeast winters. The sizing chart was super accurate--I usually buy medium/large clothes but based on size chart I was a small and sure enough the small fits great.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate! Great jacket!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last in January 2016 and it's amazing. I've used it in the pouring rain, wind, whatever. It's definitely waterproof. The inner fleece is probably my favorite fleece. I wear it alllllll the time. It's perfectly warm and doesn't get too hot. I separated it from the outer layer and if it's gets really cold then I will combine both layers. At 140$ it's all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Danny D

customer_reviews.title: great jacket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son. It was true to size and was delivered as promised. My son loves it. It's water repellent; has a full zip out light jacket for not so cold temps; and when both layers are used, it is extremely warm in cold temps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a bit larger, but warm and nice
customer_reviews.text: Even though I actually tried one on in a store, the one I got seems a bit larger. Also, in day to day life, it seems that the fact the sleeve is double (inner and outer) make it a bit hard to wear (it pulls the underlying shirt sleeve up, sometimes all the way up to the elbow. It hasn't been really cold this year so I can't testify on that, but at 10 celsius it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Oren

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: Got a great price because I have an odd size they apparently were over stocked on. I looked at a lot of reviews for Columbia and North Face, and a couple of other brands. It's light weight and super warm, and I like the flexibilty of it being convertable.
customer_reviews.author: Person

customer_reviews.title: but this is a good winter coat
customer_reviews.text: I miss all the pockets Columbia used to include, but this is a good winter coat. Used in 20 degree temps and stays plenty warm while sitting and moves well when hiking. So far so good, we'll see what a couple of winters does.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Nice price - good features- and as and added benefit ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice price - good features- and as and added benefit if ever needed - when you turn it inside out you can and put a strobe light on it can be used at a disco dance floor.
customer_reviews.author: gettanet

customer_reviews.title: This product is of good quality and will be bought next time.
customer_reviews.text: This product is of good quality and will be bought next time.
customer_reviews.author: zhangqing

customer_reviews.title: Another coat worthy of the Columbia name
customer_reviews.text: I've never been disappointed with a Columbia coat purchase and this coat maintains their record. The reflective lining keeps the weight of the coat down without sacrificing warmth. I wanted it to replace my midrange coat, 15-40 degrees or so. It fits well- I have long arms so I got a tall size. Great coat!
customer_reviews.author: TZ

customer_reviews.title: Good jacket for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: So far good. Good # of pockets to carry gloves, phones, reading glasses. Similar jackets at other brands a little expensive than this one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ramakrishnan

customer_reviews.title: Keeps him nice and warm
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend loves this coat. Keeps him nice and warm. Color is true as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Nice coat
customer_reviews.text: I Like it , it fits, its warm.i am 6ft 240lbs the xxl fit just right
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Awesome jacket but i followed the size chart and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome jacket but i followed the size chart and it fits a bit, just a bit large, despite this, everything as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Best coat ever purchased!!!

I used the liner while there but have removed it since returning home. It is just as comfortable either way. The liner is extremely easy to install and remove in just a couple of minutes.

product_meta.title: Columbia Sportswear Men's Bugaboo Interchange Jacket with Detachable Storm Hood
product_meta.description: We've added our patented thermal reflective technology to this classic winter Interchange jacket, delivering an even warmer winter weather fighter with layering options galore. The technical outer shell is waterproof breathable, with adjustability at the hood, hem and cuffs and the new zip-in fleece liner features thermal reflectivity, which reflects your body heat for warmth while maintaining a high level of breathability. Each piece works as an outer layer on its own during moderate conditions, or wear them together when you need the jacket's full storm-fighting power. How to Measure: 1. Neck: Measure at the base or thickest part of your neck. 2. Sleeves: Start at the center back of your neck and measure across the shoulder and down to the wrist. Round up to the next even number. 3. Chest/Bust: Measure at the fullest part of the chest, under the armpits and over the shoulder blades, keeping the tape measure firm and level.
